stadium.name: The Unruly Yard
stadium.description: A field in the center of the city's most rebellious district. The stadium is covered in graffiti, the crowd is hostile, and riots are a common post-game (and mid-game) event.

stats.pregame_ritual: Drinking a shot of hot gravy from a dented tin cup.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Testing the heft of their weapon with a series of slow, deliberate swings.
Kissing the Trollball on its stitched 'nose'.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Refusing to step on any lines on the field before the whistle blows.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.

stadium.name: The Oakmaul Grounds
stadium.description: Built over the site of the final battle during the liberation of Hafting now rises The Oakmaul Grounds—part arena, part monument. The central oak still bears the burn scars of the final battle. Troll ball here feels more like ritual than sport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Wiggling their fingers in a complex, magical-looking pattern.
Tying their bootlaces together and hopping to the starting line.
Attempting to communicate with birds.
Chewing a specific, bitter root said to improve night vision.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Organizing a small betting pool on who will score first.
Asking the Trollball for advice, and pretending to listen to its response.
Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Anointing their forehead with morning dew.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.

preGame:
Greetings, you bloodthirsty maniacs and degenerate gamblers! It's Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the most wonderfully derelict corner of Osterra—The Unruly Yard in New Monteforte! We’re deep in the Losers Bracket playoffs, where the air is thick with the scent of desperation and stale beer! This is Game 2 of a Best-of-3 series, and folks, the stakes couldn't be higher! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures are sitting pretty with a 1-0 lead, looking to send The Greenwatch packing back to their leafy little groves for good! If the Greenwatch doesn't find some spine today, they'll be watching the rest of the tournament from the sidelines with the rest of the 'heroes'!

Take a look at the atmosphere here—the graffiti is fresh, the scaffolding is swaying in the breeze like a drunk giant, and the fans are already throwing garbage at the referees! I love it! Down on the field, the rituals are in full swing. Mouldon Earl of the Chaos Creatures is currently hopping around like a madman, refusing to step on any white lines—good luck with that once the blood starts splashing! Meanwhile, for the Greenwatch, Verne Methuselah is giving the Trollball her signature 'grip' treatment by rubbing it deep in her armpits! It’s enough to make a demon weep with joy, or at least reach for a handkerchief!

And let's not forget the sheer 'heroism' on display. We’ve got the Greenwatch, backed by those self-righteous Wardens like Sir Randy. I hope his 'fancy bow' can help him aim a pint, because his team is going to need it if they lose this one! On the other side, Dame Terra Monteforte’s favorite rebels are looking to repeat their Game 1 shutout. Will the Chaos Creatures kiss the ball’s nose for luck, or will they just use it to break a few more Greenwatch ribs? The whistle is about to blow, and I can smell the impending carnage! Let’s get ready for some TROLLBALL!
postGame:
Great galloping gargoyles, what a absolute riot! The whistle has blown, the dust has settled, and The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures have officially swept the series 2-0, leaving The Greenwatch in a pile of broken dreams and bruised egos! The final score is 3 to zip, and the Unruly Yard is erupting into a mid-game riot that warms my cold, corrupted heart! 

Things got ugly fast in Center Field when Mouldon Earl snagged the head, but the real show started with the violence! Gabriele Klehm, that quarterstaff-wielding queen of chaos, didn't waste any time. She absolutely flattened Darin Berliner and Rese Halpern back-to-back, sending them both to the healer before they could even remember their own names! It was a beautiful display of pure, unadulterated aggression that set the tone for the entire afternoon!

The Greenwatch tried to fight back, with Herriott Dhiren putting Raouf Dragone on the injury list, but the Chaos Creatures are like a hydra—cut off one head and two more start swinging broadswords! Raouf Dragone eventually dusted himself off, charged into the End Zone, and dunked that leather head like he was putting a rowdy guest out of a tavern! One point on the board for the home team, and the crowd went absolutely bananas!

But the highlight of the first half had to be Gabriele Klehm again! Not content with just breaking bones, she took a wild shot from Center Field and—swish!—straight through the goal for a two-pointer! That's how you play the game, folks! No fancy heroics, just a solid throw and a lot of shouting. By the time the halftime whistle blew, the Chaos Creatures were up 3-0 and the Greenwatch looked like they’d been run over by a wagon train.

Halftime saw the healers doing overtime, and Nariko Javed was wiggling those fingers like they were trying to weave a sweater out of thin air! Whatever magic they were cooking up didn't help much in the second half, though. The violence only intensified! Troy Jorgan managed to take out Mouldon Earl, and Drona Jacklin sent Tucker Hett to the dirt, but the Chaos Creatures just kept coming. It was a carousel of carnage that would make Lord Orzalon proud!

Let's talk about the 'heroes' for a second. Sir Randy and his Warden pals must be weeping in their tea right now! The Greenwatch players like Madea Mensch and Salahi Bushey were throwing wild passes that were getting intercepted faster than a bribe at a Guild meeting! Urata Oriana and Drona Jacklin were snagging the ball out of the air like it was their lucky day, proving that 'luck' is just another word for being in the right place to hit someone!

The second half was a defensive stalemate, if by 'defensive' you mean both teams were too busy hitting each other to actually score! Wolbrom Ariella was getting targeted like he owed everyone money, getting injured not once, but twice by Herriott Dhiren and Drona Jacklin! It was a masterpiece of physical play that left the field looking more like a battlefield than a sports arena.

Even with Alben Diantha and Goldenberg Rimola trading heavy blows and racking up the injury count, the Greenwatch simply couldn't find the basket. They were rubbing that ball in their armpits for grip, but they couldn't hold onto a lead if their lives depended on it! Every time they got close, a Chaos Creature like Fogel Raynold was there to stop the run or force a drop. 

And what about the drunken state of the pitch? With the fans pouring ale over the unstable scaffolding, I’m surprised anyone could stand straight! Placido Kora was running around like she'd had a few too many of Imra’s elixirs, missing tackles left and right, but it didn't matter because the Greenwatch was even worse! It was a clumsy, bloody, beautiful mess of a game.

So there you have it, folks! The New Monteforte Chaos Creatures move on in the Losers Bracket, and The Greenwatch is officially out of the playoffs! They can go back to whispering to birds and chewing roots in the woods. The Chaos Creatures are the masters of mayhem today, winning 3-0 and taking the series! 

I’m Nok the Corrupter, and if you're looking for me, I'll be at the victory party trying to convince the street performers to set something on fire! Stay brutal, Osterra, and we'll see you next week for more Tuesday Night Trollball! What a game! What a sweep! What a glorious disaster!
